thread.title: #InspireCourage: Selling bottled water helps Cebuano student graduate
thread.title_full: #InspireCourage: Selling bottled water helps Cebuano student graduate

author: Apple Danuco
title: #InspireCourage: Selling bottled water helps Cebuano student graduate
text:
#InspireCourage: Selling bottled water helps Cebuano student graduate This bubbly street vendor brings joy to passersby in Cebu City with his jokes and colorful costumes Published 9:14 PM, March 19, 2017 Updated 9:14 PM, March 19, 2017 INSPIRING. Jay Krummer "Dodoy" Teberio graduates from college after years of selling bottled water on the streets for a living. All photos courtesy of Jay Teberio 
CEBU, Philippines – Jay Kummer “Dodoy” Teberio, a 21-year old Cebuano who sold bottled water to send himself to school, has finally graduated from college on Wednesday, March 15. 
Teberio is a familiar face along A. Soriano St in Barangay Mabolo, Cebu City. The bubbly street vendor brings joy to passersby with his jokes and colorful costumes. 
He said he started wearing costumes and making jokes to attract and entertain more customers. 
“ Actually mao gyud ni ang gitawag nga effort. Ako gusto kay makuha ang attention sa mga tao nga manlabay, maong nakahuna-huna ko nga ing-ani ako pamaagi sa pagbaligya og tubig ,” he said. 
(I put more effort. I want to catch people’s attention, so I thought of a unique way to sell bottled water.) 
Since 2007, Teberio and his family have been selling in streets, their sole source of income. Teberio, then a 12-year-old grade school student, would wake up early to help his mother set up their small stall. By 7 am, he would leave for school. He would return to their family's stall after dismissal and help his mother sell more bottled water. 
This has been Teberio's daily routine until he reached his last year in college. 
Victim of bullying 
Teberio's life growing up was not as colorful as the costumes he wore to the streets. In an interview with Rappler, Teberio shared that he got bullied by his classmates because of what his family does for a living. 
Instead of getting discouraged, he continued working to help improve his family's condition. 
“ Gi- bully ko sauna kay tungod lagi kay mamaligya ko og tubig unya ang uban muana nga boang daw ko pero wala nako gi- mind . Ako nalang gihuna-huna nga usahay kay kailangan ta maka- experience og ing-ana ,” Teberio revealed. 
(My classmates used to bully me because I was selling bottled water. Others even told me I’m crazy, but I did not care. I just put in mind that sometimes we need to experience hardship in life.) EDUCATION. Jay Teberio dreams of being a teacher someday. 
Soon-to-be teacher 
Teberio eventually enrolled at the University of Cebu, where he took up Bachelor of Science in Education and majored in music, arts, physical education and health (MAPEH). 
For being a good example and inspiration to others, he received the " Mayor's Special Award" during the city's Charter Day on February 24. The young water vendor dedicated the award to his family. 
“ Wala ko nagdahom nga maing-ani ni siya kay ako ga enjoy ra man gud ko. Ako I ’m a happy person bisan og naa ko mga problema, mu- smile lang gyod ko para mawala. Dili nalang nako huna-hunaon ,” Teberio said. 
(I did not imagine things will turn out this way. I am just enjoying what I’m doing. I am a very happy person, and when I have problems, I just smile to comfort myself.) 
Understanding the importance of education, Teberio dreams of becoming a teacher to share knowledge to the youth. 
“ Ang ako usa ra gyod akong pangandoy og mao na ang mahimong teacher. Ganahan ko ako knowledge kay e- share nako sa laing tao. Mao gyod pud na ang akong passion, ug para makatabang pud sa akong pamilya para mahaw-as pud sila sa ilang kalisud, ” he said. 
(My dream is to become a teacher. I want to share my knowledge to other people. That has always been my passion, and I want to lift my family out of poverty.) 
“ Kung naa mo pangandoy sa kinabuhi, dapat laban lang gyud. 'Wag kang titigil hanggang 'di mo nararating ang mga pangarap mo sa buhay. Ang kapobre dili gyud babag, ” he added. 
(If you have dreams in life, fight for it and don’t ever give up until you achieve it. Being poor is not a hindrance to getting an education.) 
Teberio plans to take the Licensure Examination for Teachers (LET) in September. – Rappler.com 
Apple Grace Danuco is a graduating student at the University of San Jose Recoletos. She is also the lead Rappler Mover in Cebu. HOW DOES THIS STORY MAKE YOU FEEL? Happy
